tv.amwa.maj.io.mxf

Interface MXFFile

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MXFFileImpl

    public interface MXFFile
extends Cloneable

    Represents and provides access to the components of an MXF file, including the partitions that it contains.

    To open an MXF file and to start reading it, call static method MXFFactory.readPartitions(String) and then access the data it contains using the methods of this class.

    See Also:
    MXFFactory.readPartitions(String)

    • Method Detail

      • open

        boolean open(String filename,
             boolean readOnly)
      throws IOException

        Open the MXF file with the given name for read-only or read-write as required.

        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file to open.
        readOnly - Open the file read-only? Set to true for read-only and false for read-write.
        Returns:
        Was the file successfully opened and the beginning of the header partition found?
        Throws:
        IOException - A problem occurred when trying to open the specified file.
        See Also:
        MXFFactory.readPartitions(String)

      • close

        boolean close()

        Close this MXF file, preventing further access and releasing any associated resources. Applications should close MXF files as soon as they are finished reading or writing them.

        Returns:
        Was the file successfully closed?

      • getRunInSize

        @UInt32
int getRunInSize()

        Returns the length of any run in found in the file. A run-in is optional in an MXF file.

        Returns:
        Length of any run in found in the file.
        See Also:
        hasRunIn(), readRunIn()

      • hasRunIn

        boolean hasRunIn()

        Determines whether this file has an optional run-in.

        Returns:
        Does this file have an optional run-in?
        See Also:
        getRunInSize(), readRunIn()

      • readRunIn

        boolean readRunIn()
           throws IOException

        Read the internal pointer passed any run-in to the beginning of the header partition.

        Returns:
        Is the position of the MXF file set at the beginning of the header partition, just beyond the run-in.
        Throws:
        IOException - Problem reading the underlying MXF file.
        See Also:
        getRunInSize(), hasRunIn()

      • atEOF

        boolean atEOF()

        Determine if the internal file pointer at the end of the file?

        Returns:
        Is the internal file pointer at the end of the file?

      • buildPartitionsTable

        boolean buildPartitionsTable()
                      throws IOException,
                             EndOfDataException

        Build a partition table from this MXF file containing all the byte offsets of all the partitions in this MXF file. It is necessary to call this method before calling any of the other methods that reference partitions.

        Returns:
        Successful creation of the partition table.
        Throws:
        IOException - Problem occurred when trying to read the file.
        EndOfDataException - Unexpectedly reached the end of the file, for example when reading through a partition table.

      • countPartitions

        int countPartitions()

        Count the number of partitions in this file. A value of zero may indicate that the partitions table still needs to be built with buildPartitionsTable().

        Returns:
        Number of partitions in the file.
        See Also:
        getPartitionAt(int), buildPartitionsTable()

      • getPartitionAt

        Partition getPartitionAt(int index)
                  throws IndexOutOfBoundsException

        Returns the partition at the given index in the partition table. The partitions are ordered in the sequence they occur in the file, with the partition at index zero being the header partition.

        Parameters:
        index - Index of the partition table to retrieve.
        Returns:
        Partition at the given index in the index table.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - No parition at the given index, or the partition table has not yet been built with buildPartitionsTable().
        See Also:
        buildPartitionsTable()

      • getHeaderPartition

        HeaderPartition getHeaderPartition()

        Get access to the header partition of this file. Ensure that the partition table has been built first with buildPartitionsTable().

        Returns:
        Header partition of the file, or null if the file is invalid or the partitions table has not yet been built.
        See Also:
        getHeaderPartition(), buildPartitionsTable()

      • getFooterPartition

        FooterPartition getFooterPartition()

        Get access to the footer partition of this file. Ensure that the partition table has been built first with buildPartitionsTable() or a null may be returned unexpectedly.

        Returns:
        Footer partition of the file or null if a footer partition is not found.
        See Also:
        getFooterPartition(), buildPartitionsTable()

      • getRandomIndexPack

        RandomIndexPack getRandomIndexPack()

        Returns the random index pack from the end of the file, or null if the file does not have a random index pack.

        Returns:
        Random index pack from the end of the file if it exists, otherwise null.

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()

        Determines if this MXF file is open and therefore and ready to be read and written to.

        Returns:
        Is this MXF file open?
        See Also:
        close()

      • addHeaderPartition

        HeaderPartition addHeaderPartition(boolean closed,
                                   boolean complete,
                                   long initialSize,
                                   int bodySID,
                                   int indexSID,
                                   UL... containerFormats)

      • clone

        MXFFile clone()

        Returns a cloned copy of the MXF file representation. Note that the MXF file itself is not copied.

        Returns:
        Cloned copy of the MXF file representation.
